Jquery.question: What is jQuery?
Jquery.ans:
jQuery is a JavaScript Library aiming at Write less and  do more. 
jQuery simplifies HTML document traversing, event handling, animating, 
and Ajax interactions for rapid web development.

Jquery.question: What are the core features of jQuery?
Jquery.ans:
Key features of Jquery are 
DOM manipulation, Event handling, AJAX Support,Animations,Lightweight,Selectors

Jquery.question: What is the diffrence between document ready and onload ?
Jquery.ans:
Document ready is triggered the moment the DOM is loaded, While window onload is 
 triggered only after all the resources like images are loaded.

Jquery.question: What are the diffrent selectors available ?
Jquery.ans:
Diffrent types of selectors are 
1)Element Selector 
2)ID Selector 
3)class selector 
 parent and child selector , odd and even selector

Jquery.question: what is $proxy
Jquery.ans: $Proxy is used to bind a scope to the callback function in jquery

Jquery.question: what are the common functions in jquery ?
We can use even or odd selectors
What is the diffrence between props and attr ?
Jquery.ans:
ATTR  gets the value of an attribute for the first element in the set of matched element. 
 PROPS gets the value of a property for the first element in the set of matched elements. It is introduced in jQuery 1.6.

Jquery.question: How do you handle events in Jquery ?
Jquery.ans:
We can add events using $on followed by event name selector and a call back function. 
We can remove the event by using the jquery method off.

Jquery.question: Can we change $ to in Jquery ?
How can you use multiple versions of Jquery ?
Jquery.ans: With the help of jquery.noCOnflict we can use multiple versions of Jquery.

Jquery.question: What is the difference between find and children methods?
Jquery.ans:
Find method is used to find all levels down the DOM tree while children method is used 
to find single level down the DOM tree.

Jquery.question: What is the difference between ID selector and class selector in jQuery?
Jquery.ans:
ID selector uses # has the prefix and returns a single element. It is always unique. 
 Where as Class selector use dot and returns a list of element having  the class name.

Jquery.question: How to add and remove CSS classes to an element using jQuery?
Jquery.ans:
We can use add class to add a css class to element 
 We can use  remove class to remove a css class from a element.

HTML.question: What are the features in HTML5 ?
HTML.ans:
Some of the key features of html5 is semantic tags like 
 HEADER , 
FOOTER , 
 SECTION,
  New input elements like EMAIL , DATE , RANGE etc. 
 New apis are introduced like  local storage, web db . To implement animations html 5 supports canvas tag. We can use Audio and vidio tags to play the vidio and ausio.

HTML.question: What is local storage ?
HTML.ans: Local storage allows us to store data in the form of kwy value pair. Value should be always a string.

HTML.question: How do you store object inside a local storage ?
HTML.ans: We can store object by Stringifying it by using the JSON.stringify method.  While we retrive it we need to use the JSON.parse method to convert the string to JSON object.

HTML.question: What is the diffrence between local storage and session storage ?
HTML.ans: localStorage: stores data with no expiration date, and gets cleared only through JavaScript, or clearing the Browser Cache.  sessionStorage is similar to localStorage but expires when the browser is closed.

HTML.question: What is the diffrence between inline and block element ?
HTML.ans: block elements take the entire row and appears one above other, where as inline elements will occupy only the required width and appear next to each other

HTML.question: How can you convert inline element to a block element ?
HTML.ans: By changing the css display property to block we can chang the inline element to block element

HTML.question: What is the diffrence between inline block and inline ?
HTML.ans: inline elements will not have css width property , where as inline-bloc can have a css width property.

HTML.question: What is Canvas tag ?
HTML.ans: With canvas tag we can create animations and effects. With this tag we can avoid use of external plugins like adobe flash.

HTML.question: What is SVG tag ?
HTML.ans:
SVG stands for Scalable Vector Graphics. It is basically used to define graphics. 
 SVG is vector graphic base, it can scale any size to fit web pages. unlike the image format it does not consist of a fixed set of dots, but of shapes and their attributes, so it can be saved as the smallest size possible. No matter how large the graphic gets, the XML that describes the graphic is the only thing transmitted to the client.
 It can be bandwidth friendly

HTML.question: What is doctype in html ?
HTML.ans:
doctype is an instruction to the web browser about what version of HTML the page is written in. some of the doctypes are 
 STRICT, LOOSE, FRAMESET, TRANSITIONAL

HTML.question: What is semantic tags in html 5
HTML.ans:
Some of the semantic tags in html 5 are HEADER,FOOTER,SECTION and ASIDE. 
 These tags   helps in SEO optimization and improving accessability

CSS.question: What diffrence between display none and visibility ?
CSS.ans: display-none hides the element and will not occupy any space , where-as visibility-hidden will hide the element, but it will take its space.

CSS.question: What is the diffrence between inline and block element ?
CSS.ans: block elements take the entire row and appears one above other, where as inline elements will occupy only the required width and appear next to each other

CSS.question: How can you convert inline element to a block element ?
CSS.ans: By changing the css display property to block we can chang the inline element to block element

CSS.question: What is the diffrence between inline block and inline ?
CSS.ans: inline elements will not have css width property , where as inline-bloc can have a css width property.

CSS.question: What is Specificity ?
CSS.ans:
Specificity defines the css-rules. It explains about the order in which the css style would override the other rule.
Example ID selector would take the highest presedence over element tag.

CSS.question: What is CSS3
CSS.ans:
CSS3 comes with lot of new features such as 2d and 3d animation 
. new features like border-radius , opacity etc.

CSS.question: What is CSS3
CSS.ans:
CSS3 comes with lot of new features such as 2d and 3d animation 
. new features like border-radius,Multiple Column Layout , opacity etc.

CSS.question: What is box model ?
CSS.ans: Box model basically starts with content , padding , border and margin

CSS.question: What is pseudo selectors ?
CSS.ans: pseudo selectos helpes us to apply css to elements based on pseudo attributes like hover, before , after

CSS.question: What are diffrent positions in css
CSS.ans: Diffrent positions in css are Absolute , Relative , Fixed and Static. By default it takes static position.

CSS.question: What are diffrence between absolute and relative ?
CSS.ans: Absolute position takes it position from the top of the body irrespective of its current position. Where-as relative takes the position from its current position.

JAVASCRIPT.question: What are the data types in javascript?
JAVASCRIPT.ans:
Diffrent data  types in Javascript are number , String, Boolean.
In javascript we define a variable using the keyword var.

JAVASCRIPT.question: What is prototype in javascript ?
JAVASCRIPT.ans: prototype is a built-in  object of any function in javascript. While creating a class in javascript if we want to have member functions we should use prototype dot function name rahter than this dot function name. It helps in having single copy of menber function for each and every object. This saves memory. prototype is also useful while implementing the inheritance.

JAVASCRIPT.question: How many types of functions JavaScript supports?
JAVASCRIPT.ans:
A function in JavaScript can be either named or anonymous. 
We can also create a variable and assign function to it.

JAVASCRIPT.question: What is the diffrence between == and ===
JAVASCRIPT.ans: double equals compares for value where as === compares for both value and data type. for Example if we compare true == 1 it will give true,  but if we compare true===1 it will return false since the data type dont match.

JAVASCRIPT.question: What is a closures ?
JAVASCRIPT.ans: closures is an approach in javascript , where we retain the state of a function even after its execution, either by returning the anonymous function or a JSON object.

JAVASCRIPT.question: How do you implement inheritance in javascript
JAVASCRIPT.ans:
We can implement inheritance by assigning the prototype of the parent function to child functions prototype.
 Then to initialize  the parents class properties we need to use use parent function dot call then pass the parameters

JAVASCRIPT.question: What is hoisting ?
JAVASCRIPT.ans:
In javascript we assign a value to a variable and declare it later. This is know as hoisting.
 For example : i can have name ='xyz'  then followed by var name

JAVASCRIPT.question: What is callback ?
JAVASCRIPT.ans:
A callback is a plain JavaScript function passed to some method as an argument or option. 
.

JAVASCRIPT.question: What is call
JAVASCRIPT.ans: Every function in javascript will have a method called call. We can use this method to call the function. It takes the paramenters in comma separated

JAVASCRIPT.question: What is Apply
JAVASCRIPT.ans: Every function in javascript will have a method called Apply. We can use this method to call the function. It takes the paramenters in array .

JAVASCRIPT.question: What is Apply
JAVASCRIPT.ans: Every function in javascript will have a method called Apply. We can use this method to call the function. It takes the paramenters in array .

ANGULAR.question: What is AngularJS?
ANGULAR.ans: AngularJS is a framework to build large scale and high performance web application while keeping them as easy-to-maintain. Following are the features of AngularJS framework.

ANGULAR.question: What is data binding in AngularJS?
ANGULAR.ans: Data binding is the automatic synchronization of data between model and view components. ng-model directive is used in data binding.

ANGULAR.question: What is scope in AngularJS?
ANGULAR.ans: Scopes are objects that refer to the model. They act as glue between controller and view.

ANGULAR.question: What are the controllers in AngularJS?
ANGULAR.ans: Controller acts as a thin layer between modal and the view. It carry functions to operate on data and decide which view is to be updated to show the updated model based data

ANGULAR.question: What are the services in AngularJS?
ANGULAR.ans: Services are singleton objects which are instantiated only once in app.

ANGULAR.question: What are the filters in AngularJS?
ANGULAR.ans: Filters select a subset of items from an array and return a new array. Filters are used to show filtered items from a list of items based on defined criteria.

ANGULAR.question: Explain directives in AngularJS.
ANGULAR.ans: Helps in creating reusable components. A directive can be a element , attribute or a comment.

ANGULAR.question: Explain templates in AngularJS.
ANGULAR.ans: Templates are the rendered view with information from the controller and model. These can be a single file (like index.html) or multiple views in one page using partials

ANGULAR.question: What is routing in AngularJS?
ANGULAR.ans: It is concept of switching views. AngularJS based controller decides which view to render based on the business logic.

ANGULAR.question: What are the advantages of AngularJS?
ANGULAR.ans:
AngularJS provides capability to create Single Page Application in a very clean and maintainable way. 
 AngularJS provides data binding capability to HTML thus giving user a rich and responsive experience. 
 AngularJS uses dependency injection and make use of separation of concerns. 
In AngularJS, views are pure html pages, and controllers written in JavaScript do the business processing. 
  AngularJS applications can run on all major browsers and smart phones including Android and iOS based phones/tablets.

ANGULAR.question: What is MVC?
ANGULAR.ans:
Model − It is the lowest level of the pattern responsible for maintaining data. 
 View − It is responsible for displaying all or a portion of the data to the user. 
 Controller − It is a software Code that controls the interactions between the Model and View.

ANGULAR.question: Explain ng-app directive
ANGULAR.ans: ng-app directive defines and links an AngularJS application to HTML. It also indicate the start of the application.

ANGULAR.question: What is the difference between 1way and 2way binding
ANGULAR.ans: in case of one way binding we bind the model with elements like paragraph tag  or a span tag where we dont update the data from UI. For this we use ng-bind. In case  of 2 way binding we bind input elements like text box radio button etc with the modal. In this case change on modal will update the UI and change on the UI will update the modal.

ANGULAR.question: How do you share data between controllers.
ANGULAR.ans: We can share data between controllers by using services or rootScope. Incase if both the controllers are running we can use events.

ANGULAR.question: How do you share data between controllers.
ANGULAR.ans: We can share data between controllers by using services or rootScope. Incase if both the controllers are running we can use events.

ANGULAR.question: What is a service?.
ANGULAR.ans: Services are JavaScript functions and are responsible to do specific tasks only

ANGULAR.question: factory method is used to define a factory which can later be used to create services as and when required whereas service method is used to create a service whose purpose is to do some defined task.
